entry.title: Re: How Can You Simplify SAP Service Cloud CTI Integration Testing? Try This Dynamic POC Widget!
entry.content:
Hi @fsg ,

Thank you for comments.
Regarding your questions:

1. the CTI provider should send the supported params for each phone event (e.g. incoming call) via query string on the widget URI to compose the payload (run-time) to be sent through Javascript to the built-in object. Is that correct?

Answer:
It’s not strictly required for the CTI provider to send parameters via query string on the widget URI.

What matters is that the widget itself (running in the iframe) sends a properly formatted payload — using either JSON or XML, as per SAP documentation — to the parent window via the window.parent.postMessage() method.

The payload can represent events like INBOUND, ACCEPT, END, etc., and should follow the expected structure defined by SAP Service Cloud.

How the provider chooses to build that payload (e.g., via JavaScript, or another method, or even using query parameters to inject values into the widget at runtime) is entirely up to them. The key requirement is that the final postMessage call from the widget to the parent window sends the correct payload format.

In summary:

  1. The payload must be sent from the widget to the parent, using window.parent.postMessage()
  2. The format can be JSON or XML, depending on what's supported by your CTI
  3. The method of building the payload is flexible, as long as the output complies with the documented CTI interface

2. only client-side scripting on the Widget (HTML) is allowed, but server-side it is not, isn't it?

A widget based integration is required here.

entry.title: Re: Dynamic Text box
entry.content:
@Carvalho_A1 

Not sure how do you select the year for your table. Assuming you select 2026 and Date hierarchy is set to Year/Month, something like below could help.

You create a scriptvariable of type string from the outline view. 

After adding the text box you can assign it with dynamic text to ScriptVariable.

 

Place the below code either on on initialization of page or on result changed of table

//Read the date filter
var filters=Table_1.getDataSource().getDimensionFilters("Date");

if (filters.length > 0) 
		{
            var singleFilter = cast(Type.SingleFilterValue, filters[0]);
            var selectedValue = singleFilter.value;
        }

// Split the string by '.' and take the year
var selyear = selectedValue.split('.');
var yearstr = selyear[selyear.length - 1];

// Remove the square brackets
var year = yearstr.slice(1, -1);

console.log(year); // Output: 2026

ScriptVariable_1=year;

 

 

Hope this heps !!

Nikhil

entry.title: Re: Improvements to Wave Simulation Stock Checks and Logging
entry.content:
Hello @yogesh_agarwal2 

Great question. Here’s a breakdown of how to handle both the stock selection logic and log enhancements for wave simulation in SAP EWM.

1.Exclude Blocked Bins & Restricted Batches in Wave Simulation

Wave simulation considers stock based on availability and removal rules. To ensure only valid stock is simulated:

2. Storage Type Settings

Use /SCWM/STORAGETYPE to define picking storage types that:

  • Exclude blocked or non-pickable bins (via stock removal rules or bin access types)
  • Apply the correct stock removal indicators

3.Batch Status Control

Ensure batch status management is active:

  • In /SCWM/MAT1, under Batch Status Selection, restrict to unrestricted-use only
  • Batch determination strategy (optional) should also exclude restricted batches

4.Stock Type & Availability Group

Use /SCWM/AVAILGRP to assign only relevant stock types (F1 - unrestricted) to your delivery type. Ensure the warehouse process type maps correctly in /SCWM/PTRULE.

5. Enhance Simulation Logs with Root Cause

Standard logs don’t show why stock isn’t allocated. To enhance this:

6. Implement BAdI /SCWM/EX_WAVE_SIMULATION

It allows you to intercept simulation logic and add custom log messages for issues like:

  • Only restricted batches are available
  • Stock exists in the blocked bin
  • Mismatched stock type

Populate the ET_LOG structure with messages tied to affected items.

  1. Use Transaction SLG1 for Technical Logs

    Object: /SCWM/WAVE_SIM

  • Subobject: warehouse number or delivery
  • This can help identify low-level issues, but may require enhancement for clarity.

SAP Documentation

  • Wave Management – SAP Help Portal

BAdI /SCWM/EX_WAVE_SIMULATION – Enhancement Spot: /SCWM/ES_WAVE_SIMULATION

Let me know if it helps

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: F0797 Manage Billing Document Fiori App Extension - C...
entry.content:
Hello @zajde1jc 

You're right, the F0797 Manage Billing Documents app doesn't support behaviour extensions, as it's built on a CDS view without RAP actions.

SAP Recommended Approach (for S/4HANA 2023 Private Cloud):

Use a UI5 adaptation project or custom UI5 extension to:

  • Add a custom button via a fragment in the table toolbar
  • Capture selected records
  • Trigger your backend logic (custom OData function import or RFC)

This is the only supported way to implement mass changes with a custom button in this app, since key-user tools (e.g. RTA) don't allow adding custom actions.

SAP Documentation References

  • Extending SAP Fiori Elements Apps
  • SAP Fiori Elements Extension Points
  • Using the Flexible Programming Model

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: LMS Newly added content not visible to user for alrea...
entry.content:
If you have FTP access to iContent, this is what we do:

  1. Upload the SCORM files to iContent via FTP, we do NOT use the built in upload tools in SF. Example: MySCORM_V1
  2. When creating the Content Object, we paste in the URL to the SCORM package that we added via FTP in step 1.
  3. When we need to update the content, we manually upload another SCORM package. Example: MySCORM_V2
  4. We then update the URL in the Content Object to point to MySCORM_V2.
  5. Everyone will now see tghe new content, either when they go through the item for the first time, or if they choose to review the item.

entry.title: Re: Activated the materail ledger by mistake using FCML4H...
entry.content:
Hello @RaghavanKathamuthu 

Once you've run FCML4H_STARTUP, the Material Ledger is activated and cannot be deactivated; this is confirmed in SAP Notes like 2154420 and 108374. Even if you haven’t posted data yet, SAP does not support rolling it back in S/4HANA.

What you can do:

  • Fix the cost component errors (via OKTZ, OKKN)
  • Complete the Material Ledger and actual costing setup (CKMSTART, OMX1–OMX3)

If this happened in a test client, a system/client refresh is the only clean way to revert.

1768489 - Deactivate the Material Ledger for a plant

Best regards,
Chuma

entry.title: New ILX Blues
entry.content:
Is anyone else getting a lot of unhappy user feedback about the new ILX? Our users are not liking the new interface. 

We might be in a more unique situation – we have a lot of users who do not sit at a desk. They are provided iPhones and iPads with the SuccessFactors Mobile app installed.  We usually assign eLearning every quarter in the form of a curriculum. All items in the curriculum are always due at the same time. Some people have multiple curricula, each with many items. I was talking to one learner who had 3 curricula with a total of 43 items on their learning plan. 

There are a few changes that are making it very hard for our learners to find their learning:

  1. The new Learning page does not sort assigned items the same as it used to. Previously it sorted by due date and then by item title.  Because all items in our curricula are due atr the same time, it was easy to force the first item to the top of the list and the last item to the bottom. In the new ILX it sorts items by item ID. This is going to force us to change our naming convention for items, which will affect our reporting and other downstream systems.
  2. The Required learning cards in the new ILX do not have images. We make custom thumbnail images for each curriculum, making it easy for learners to visually sort which item goes with which curriculum but they are not displayed in the new ILX on the required learning page.
  3. The Apple version of the SF app does not support learners clicking on an item in the list of item prereqs, therefore learners cannot use that view to see and launch items. They must view the list, then go find the item in their required learning.
  4. Learners used to be able to search their learning plan, that functionality has been removed in the new ILX.

But wait - you are probably saying use the curriculum view! The curriculum view would show items in their intended order and would show only the items in the curriculum. The SF App has never supported the curriculum view. It's a very popular feature request, but it has not yet made it onto the roadmap for development.

I would be grateful for any best practices out there to help learners navigate the new LMS landscape.

entry.title: Re: SAP Report or Table Available for Non-PO Data
entry.content:
Hello @CodyRideaux 

In SAP S/4HANA Public cloud Edition, for Non-PO Supplier Invoices (entered via the Create Supplier Invoice app), there isn’t a single out-of-the-box report that shows all the fields you've listed in one view, but you can access this data using a combination of standard apps and data sources.

Recommended Options:

Supplier Invoices – List View (App ID: F0859A) 

This is the most comprehensive standard app for invoice monitoring.

You can filter by:

  • Invoice type = Invoice
  • Purchase Order = blank (to isolate Non-PO invoices)

And view:

  • Supplier (Vendor) Name & Number
  • Amount
  • Posting Status / Invoice Status

To see GL Account and Cost Center, use the Display Line Items link or drilldown via the Manage Journal Entries app.

Manage Journal Entries (App ID: F0717A) 

This app lets you view the accounting document behind the invoice and includes:

  • GL Account
  • Cost Center
  • Vendor (if posted on vendor line)
  • Document Status / Processing Status

Use filters like:

  • Journal Entry Type = KR (vendor invoice)
  • Reference field = invoice number

Custom CDS View or Report (if needed)

If you want a single custom report showing:

  • Vendor Name + Number
  • GL Account
  • Cost Center
  • Invoice Amount
  • Status

 You can create a custom CDS View in the Custom CDS Views app using the following data sources:

  • I_SupplierInvoice
  • I_JournalEntryItem
  • I_BusinessPartner

Join them on the accounting document & company code. Exclude invoices with purchase order references (PurchaseOrder = initial).

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: DRF OUT replication settings - SAP Retail - SAP CAR
entry.content:
Hello @SilviaZankova1 

For Sales Price replication from SAP Retail to SAP CAR using DRFOUT, make sure you're using:

  • Replication Object: COND_A (Condition Data)
  • Outbound Implementation: /SAPPCE/CNDSCOND_PRICE
  • Filter by Application, Condition Type (e.g., VKP0), Sales Org, etc.
  • Ensure pricing conditions exist (e.g., via VK11) and are valid for replication

CAR expects prices as condition records, not master data, pulled from KONH/KONP.

Check SLG1 logs for COND_A, and useful trace in DRFOUT to troubleshoot. Custom implementation may be needed if using Z-condition types.

SAP References Documentations

  • SAP Help Data replication from ERP to SAP CAR
  • DRF Configuration Guide – SAP Help
  • SAP CAR Master Guide

Let me know if it works

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Manage Outbound Deliveries F0867A - is it possible to...
entry.content:
Hello @Thorsten_Miedl 

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition, the App ID F0867A-Manage Outbound Deliveries App does not support passing multiple delivery numbers as startup filters via URL or intent-based navigation.

You can only deep link to a single delivery using &/Header/<DeliveryNumber>.

Possible Workaround:

  • Use a custom UI5 or List Report app to show your filtered list.
  • From there, link to F0867A for single delivery drilldown only.

Multiple prefilled selections aren't possible in standard Fiori Elements apps in the Public Cloud.

SAP Help – Custom Analytical Queries 

Best regards,
Chuma

entry.title: Re: Document splitting issue while clearing with F-03
entry.content:
Hello @Revathi_M1 

You're right. This error occurs because the old documents (pre-2010) lack splitting data. With document splitting now active, the system can't process the clearing.

 Deactivating document splitting is not supported by SAP.

 Supported options:

  1. Manual clearing in F-03: Enter splitting info (e.g., profit center) manually during simulation.
  2. Post a clearing doc manually (via FB01 or FB50) with full splitting data.
  3. Transfer legacy open items to a new account with proper splitting, then clear.

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: How to delete Assignment in Public cloud SCCUI 104795...
entry.content:
Hello @wangxlbest 

In SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, the SSCUI 104795 – Define Splitting Structure does not allow deletion of entries once they’ve been saved. The Delete option is intentionally disabled to ensure data consistency and audit compliance, even if the assignment was added by mistake and hasn’t been used yet. This is standard system behaviour and not an error.

Recommended Options:

  • Mark the entry as unused (e.g., update the text to "Do Not Use" to avoid confusion).
  • Alternatively, you can create a new splitting structure with the correct assignments and update the assignment via SSCUI 104796 – Assign Splitting Structure.
  • If the entry is causing a deployment or system issue, you can raise an SAP support ticket under component FI-GL-SL, although deletion requests are usually not approved unless there’s a critical impact.

3381770 - Delete entries from configuration activity (SSCUI) 

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: how to repeat table in adobe form's masterpage?
entry.content:
Hello @lcs00 

Thanks for your question.

In Adobe LiveCycle (and SAP Adobe Forms), it’s not possible to place a repeating data-bound table on a master page — master pages are designed for static content only.

Recommended approach:

  • Move the table into the content area of a flowed subform on the body page.

  • Ensure the subform and table are set to allow repetition.

  • If needed, use the master page for static table headers or layout framing, but keep all data-bound tables in the content area.

Using scripts to repeat tables across pages is technically possible, but not reliable or supported for production forms — and SAP does not recommend this.

Let me know if you'd like help restructuring your layout.

Adobe Forms Design Tips 

Best regards,
Chuma

entry.title: Re: Duplicate comments in firefighter approvals
entry.content:
Hello @S0027192615 

Currently, there’s no official SAP Note confirming duplicate comments in Firefighter approvals as a standard issue in GRC 12.

Possible causes:

  • MSMP workflow config: Duplicate stages or agents may cause repeated comment logs.
  • Custom BRF+ rules or Fiori UI rendering could also lead to duplicate display.

Recommendation:

  • Review your MSMP workflow path and stages.
  • If the issue is reproducible, raise an SAP incident under GRAC_ACCESS_MANAGEMENT (EAM) with details and logs.

Execution of an Emergency Access Session

2916591 - Duplicate comments in My Inbox application

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: SAP Enable Now to WalkMe Transition Q&A
entry.content:
The announcement in 2024 that SAP was to acquire WalkMe and subsequent announcements about the strategic directions of Enable Now and WalkMe have generated a significant amount of interest from SAP customers and partners. Since those early announcements, new information has begun to become available that helps to clarify the future of Enable Now and WalkMe, following the now completed acquisition.

This post provides answers to some of the common questions on this topic and has been prepared to help our valued SAP Enable Now and WalkMe customers and partners to better understand the change. The post should be seen as a living document that will be updated as new information becomes available. The information shared in this post is our current understanding of the strategic direction and milestones associated with the transition from SAP Enable Now to WalkMe and is not a commitment to deliver any specific capability or to deliver within the discussed timelines. Plans and milestones can change and this post will be updated when new information becomes available.

Key transition milestones

QuestionAnswer
When will WalkMe Learning be available and will it be possible to create content for non-SAP systems?Currently, the WalkMe digital learning solution is planned for initial release in November 2025 and, yes, it will also be possible to create digital learning content for SAP and non-SAP applications.
Can I continue to renew my Enable Now Cloud license?It will be possible to renew your existing Enable Now Cloud license until November 2030. No renewals of Enable Now Cloud will be possible following this time.

Transitioning to WalkMe

QuestionAnswer
Is the WalkMe going to replace Enable Now in the future? Do we have a timeline of when that could happen and what will happen to existing simulations and materials?Yes, Enable Now is being phased out and will cease to exist in November 2030. Please refer to the community post Embracing the Future: Navigating the Transition with SAP Enable Now & WalkMe for additional information about the transition.
Will our Enable Now content be available in WalkMe or does it need to be manually recreated in WalkMe?Currently, it is planned that the digital learning content, such as Simulations and Book Pages, can be transferred onto the new WalkMe digital learning solution.  After moving the Enable Now digital learning content to the WalkMe platform, it will be possible to update and republish that content. There are no current plans to migrate SAP Companion content  into the actual WalkMe solution. SAP is still in discussion to identify partner services to help customers with the recreation of SAP Companion content.
What if I renew my existing Enable Now solution for a year with a view to transitioning to the release of WalkMe digital learning, due in mid 2026, and there is a delay to that release but by that time the renewal window for Enable Now Cloud is already closed?WalkMe Digital Learning will continue to evolve, so even if some of the features you require might not yet be available you can rest assured that the solution will continue to be enhanced and new features will be coming in time.
What is the alternative transition? We need to start using WalkMe DAP now; the WalkMe learning solution date is too far out.You don't need to wait for a specific release of the WalkMe digital learning solution to start your transition. You can license the WalkMe in-application solution now and start using that solution immediately; that solution contains a significant amount of functionality not available through SAP Companion. You can then transition your digital learning content to the WalkMe digital learning solution once you feel that it meets your core requirements.
What if we don't want WalkMe but want to be still able to access our Enable Now content such as guided tours?You could renew your SAP Enable Now license until the end of maintenance in November 2030. Be aware that the end of maintenance means we cannot renew Enable Now Cloud contracts for existing customers beyond that date.
Is the transition plan for On-Prem or only for the Cloud platform?This transition plan is only valid for SAP Enable Now, cloud edition and SAP Enable Now, enablement content creation edition customers.  On Premise customers who want to transition to WalkMe should consider an initial transition to Enable Now Cloud and from there to WalkMe.  This is only necessary if On Premise customers have existing Enable Now digital learning content that they wish to continue to use following the transition to WalkMe.
What is the estimated timeline for the 3-stage transition process, i.e. linking the content into the WalkMe platform, moving the content onto the WalkMe platform, and finally, deploying the content through the WalkMe platform?Each customer can go through the transition at their own pace. The WalkMe Test & Go Live license will cover a period between 4-11 months.
3-6 months to complete the transition. Manually re-creating SAP Companion and SAP Enable Now Simulations/Content Objects in WalkMe? That sounds like a lot of work on our side.The transition of digital learning content, such as Simulations, is planned to be automated, so a large portion of the work will be done by the WalkMe team. See the Community post for details: Embracing the Future: Navigating the Transition with SAP Enable Now & WalkMe. Regarding the recreation of SAP Companion content, we are working on a service-based solution to support you.
What is the process to transition from Companion to WalkMe?There are currently no plans to automatically transition the in-app content built with SAP Companion into WalkMe. Detailed usage analytics for SAP Companion content is planned to guide you in identifying which content would benefit from being recreated in WalkMe. Service offerings will be available to support the recreation process and enhancing your overall in-app experience with WalkMe.
If someone doesn't want to transition to WalkMe, can they somehow keep simulations and companion content?The only option to continue to use SAP Enable Now content after November 2030 will be to export the content into another format and host it from another server, such as SharePoint. Enable Now Cloud will cease to be available after November 2030.  It is not possible to continue to use SAP Companion content without Enable Now Manager.

WalkMe functionality

QuestionAnswer
What's the difference between WalkMe Premium and WalkMe DAP?WalkMe Premium covers one specific application or set of applications, e.g. WalkMe Premium for SAP Ariba solutions. WalkMe DAP covers all available applications, including non-SAP applications.
What is happening with SAP Companion content, such as guided tours and message bubbles? Are they available on WalkMe?WalkMe has its own in-application functionality, such as Smart Walk-Thrus that corresponding to Enable Now Guided Tours. Currently, there are no plans to migrate guided tours, or any other form of SAP Companion content, into WalkMe. SAP is working on a suitable solution with SAP partners. More information will follow.
If you purchase the WalkMe digital learning solution at the end of Q4 2025 will it automatically be updated to future releases?Yes, the WalkMe digital learning solution is a cloud offering and updates will be provided automatically.
What would be the impact if we transition to the new WalkMe digital learning solution before it reaches a mature state? We have a limitation due to a major S4/HANA transition project starting in January 2026.There is no direct impact, although it might be that not all your required features are part of the new WalkMe digital learning solution at the time that you migrate. The core features will be available with GA release that becomes available in late 2025, however, not all features currently available in Enable Now may be available in the initial release of the WalkMe learning solution.
Is there SAP standard content available for WalkMe DAP?Yes, some initial SAP standard content is already available for WalkMe DAP/Premium, e.g. for the SuccessFactors solution. More content is currently being developed and will be released over time.
Is it possible to change my previous SAP Enable Now Content in WalkMe after the transition to WalkMe? Or is the SEN content only readable after being moved to WalkMe, it is not editable?It is planned to provide editing options to customers who have transitioned from SAP Enable Now to the WalkMe digital learning solution. Enable Now digital learning content, such as Simulations and Book Pages, will be editable within the new WalkMe platform. No option will be available to transition SAP Companion content to WalkMe so this type of content must be manually recreated.
Are there plans to integrate the WalkMe digital learning solution with Signavio, Aris and/or SolMan, e.g. to share business process information between Signavio and WalkMe?We cannot comment on this at this time.
When will we have a detailed transition plan including the technical aspect and a detailed Roadmap for the WalkMe digital learning solution?We will provide this in due time.
Does WalkMe work for non-SAP applications and systems? Is there a constraint as to which applications will work such as they cannot compete with SAP offerings or will anything work?Yes, WalkMe DAP/Premium currently work for non-SAP applications and systems. We are currently working on a new WalkMe digital learning solution that will incorporate the best of SAP Enable Now and WalkMe, which will be available in Q4 of this year, and this will also work on SAP and non-SAP applications.
If we use Enable Now primarily for simulations and storage of training content are you saying those functions may not be available in WalkMe?The option to create simulations and storage of training content is planned for the new WalkMe digital learning offering that is due for initial release in late 2025. WalkMe Premium / DAP does not offer this functionality.
Is Section 508 functionality also under review since it is not addressed on this slide?Yes, WalkMe offers features and tools to enhance accessibility and help achieve Section 508 compliance.
Will the Q2 2026 release of WalkMe digital learning support all SAP Enable Now features for creating digital learning content?All the features available in Enable Now may not be available at the early releases of the WalkMe digital learning solution, but the WalkMe solution will continue to evolve. WalkMe will be able to release updates on a more frequent schedule than SAP Enable Now, which has 2 major releases per year.

Licensing

QuestionAnswer
At this moment it is not possible to purchase WalkMe as an On Premise solution, and Enable Now is not available either for new customers. When will WalkMe be available for OnPrem solutions?Please discuss this requirement with your WalkMe Sales representative.
If our organization is using Enable Now On Premise, what is the recommendation for transition?The recommendation is to switch to SAP Enable Now, Enablement Content Creation Edition and then to transition from there to WalkMe. Currently it is not planned to transition content from On Premise SAP Enable Now tenants to the WalkMe platform so if you go directly, your digital learning content must be manually recreated.
Are clients still able to purchase WalkMe if they are not an SAP client - in other words, will WalkMe exist outside of the SAP ecosystem?Yes, clients can purchase WalkMe if they are not an SAP customer.
Are SAP partners able to offer the Enable Now solution to customers? Is there a required sell authorization?Yes, partners can sell the SAP Enable Now, enablement content creation edition to customers. There's no sell certification required.
Will the license costs for customers change as a result of the transition to WalkMe? Will a new contract have to be signed to use WalkMe?There is additional license costs associated with the transition to WalkMe.  WalkMe DAP/Premium and the new WalkMe digital learning offering are separate, new solutions. Please contact your WalkMe or SAP representative to discuss pricing and contract details.
Is it correct that you have to pay for WalkMe per system/software?Yes, WalkMe Premium pricing is based on the number of users and applications. WalkMe Premium is the in-application component of WalkMe. WalkMe DAP allows the WalkMe in-application functionality to be deployed across an unlimited number of applications. The WalkMe digital learning solution pricing will be user based, once it becomes available.
Does a client's SEN licensing give them access to WalkMe software? Are there additional costs?SEN Licensing does not give access to WalkMe. If Enable Now customers wish to transition their Enable Now content onto the WalkMe platform, the Enable Now and WalkMe platforms must be licensed during the transition period. SAP will provide a WalkMe Test & Go Live license, at a significantly reduced cost, for the transition period.
Does that mean that if we are a SEN customer and do not use SAP Companion that we should switch to the new Enablement Content Creation Edition of Enable Now, or is it only available with WalkMe as a bundle?Existing Enable Now customers with access to the full capability, including SAP Companion, can transition to the Enablement Content Creation Edition of Enable Now as long as they already own WalkMe or purchase WalkMe at the same time. Once the new WalkMe digital learning solution becomes available, it will be sold independently of WalkMe DAP/Premium, i.e. the two WalkMe products are not a bundle. Please discuss any licensing requirements with your SAP or WalkMe representative.
What if we want to purchase more SEN licenses?Upsells and renewals are still available for existing Enable Now customers until November 2026.
Will the new WalkMe digital learning solution and the existing WalkMe solution be licensed as a bundle?WalkMe DAP/Premium and the new WalkMe digital learning solution are two different offerings. If you would like to use the functionality of both products, you must license each product separately. Pricing for the new WalkMe digital learning offering has not yet been released. Please discuss all licensing requirements with your SAP or WalkMe representative.
What if our initial Enable Now contract ends in January 2027 - can we agree upon a renewal prior to Nov 2026? Is the valid date key or renewal date?Yes, if your existing Enable Now contract expires in early 2027 and you are not ready to transition to the new WalkMe digital learning solution, opt for an early renewal.  This renewal must be completed prior to November 2026.
Our SEN Cloud contract is on an annual renewal basis. Would that mean that prior to November 2026, we need to think longer (renewal wise) if we are still planning somehow to renew it for the next years after 2026?Yes, for some customers, the renewal schedule will be such that you must decide more than a year ahead of the next renewal if you want to renew or transition.  It's important to make that decision prior to the November 2026 cutoff date for Enable Now Cloud renewals.
Do we have to pay double license fees during the transition period?Both solutions must be licensed in parallel if you wish to transition SAP Enable Now digital learning content to the WalkMe digital learning solution, but SAP will offer an attractively priced WalkMe digital learning transition license (“Test & Go Live”). The pricing information is not available yet; an update will follow by Q4 2025.
Is it also possible to renew Enable Now until the end of Nov 2030?It is possible to renew existing Enable Now contracts until the end of Nov 2030 but these renewals must be completed before November 30 2026. Please discuss all Enable Now renewals with your SAP representative.
When will we be able to license the new WalkMe digital learning solution?The first version of the new WalkMe digital learning solution is planned to be available in Q4 2025.  WalkMe Premium and WalkMe DAP can already be licensed.
Are there any options to end Enable Now Cloud contracts sooner so you can transfer to WalkMe?For all licensing discussions, including those related to terminating Enable Now contracts early to transition to WalkMe, please raise the discussions with your SAP representative.
How will this affect SAP Enable Now PMC partners?PMC partners will also be asked to transition to WalkMe.

Training and certification

QuestionAnswer
How does the training take place or which training documents are available for key users, content creators, etc., on SAP WalkMe?There are already training courses available on https://learning.sap.com/ – search for WalkMe.
Regarding the old certifications of SAP Enable Now Consultants, will training courses and certifications on WalkMe soon be offered on SAP Learning Hub?There are new certifications already available for WalkMe - “SAP Certified Associate – Positioning WalkMe” and SAP Certified Associate - WalkMe Digital Adoption Consultant . These certifications replace all legacy WM certifications.  Additional certifications may be added in the future, e.g. following the introduction of the WalkMe digital learning solution.

Other

QuestionAnswer
Will SAP SuccessFactors Learning be affected by WalkMe? Or will SAP SF Learning remain as a module as it is and unaffected by WalkMe?This is a separate solution and has no impact on SuccessFactors Learning.

entry.title: Mexico DIOT report issue in Public Cloud Fiori
entry.content:
Hi guys, 

I have issues with Mexico Reports. Could you help me?

1. How to add a new transaction type 07 (import of services)?
In the Mexico Diot report, there are different transaction types, like 03 Professional Services, 06 Real Estate Lease, 29 Acquisition of Other Intangible Assets, and 85 Others.
In the configuration, 03, 06, 29, and 85 are created by the system. But there is no way to create 07. Like the screenshot below:

 

2. How to add a new field 01/02 in the Mexico Diot report?
After executing “Run Statutory Report” in public cloud Fiori, the DIOT report will generate a TXT file. In this file, one field is missing. This new field is called Efecto Fiscal, 01 = With fiscal effect, 02 = No fiscal effect.
The Mexico SAT required this field in 2025.
Like the screenshot below:

entry.title: Re: Dynamic Text box
entry.content:
Hello @Carvalho_A1 

If your Date dimension isn’t defined as a true Time dimension in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC), you can’t directly display just the Year in a dynamic text box.

Solution:

In the Model, create a Calculated Dimension:

Year = year([Date])

  • In the Story, add a Story Filter on this new Year field.
  • Insert a Dynamic Text → bind it to Story Filter > Year.
  • This allows SAC to display the selected year dynamically.

SAP Help – Use of Dynamic Text in Stories

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: How to create a RAP BO to change the content of a customizing table in the production client
entry.content:
Hello @patrick_winkler 
I am facing an issue in Public Cloud - SAP S/4HANA CLOUD 2508;
I have created Custom Business Configuration using ADT but the Edit button that allows me to add entries to that object is deactivated after research, I found couple of blogs saying that because transport Record option equals Automatic, so I changed transport object properties

  1. "transportRecording": "notSupported",
  2. "adaptableInProduction": true,


but that didn't activate edit button, so I tried to remove validation methods and actions following these Steps:

  1. Edit the behavior definition,
    • delete the action "SelectCustomizingTransptReq" and all validations "ValidateTransportRequest". 
    • Remove annotation "with additional save".
    • Save and activate.

  2. Edit the Behavior Projection
    • delete the action "SelectCustomizingTransptReq".
    • Save and activate.

  3. Edit the behavior implementation class:
    • Delete the method "SelectCustomizingTransptReq"
    • Delete all methods "ValidateTransportRequest"
    • Remove all occurrences of "%ACTION-SelectCustomizingTransptReq"
    • Clear the method "SAVE_MODIFIED", that is, leave the method implementation empty
    • Delete the variable "selecttransport_flag" and its occurrences in method "GET_INSTANCE_FEATURES" of local class LHC_<singleton entity>
    • Save and activate

That also didn't solve the issue, The edit button still deactivated

so, I tried reverting everything back to original state and only commenting the GET_GLOBAL_AUTHORIZATIONS Method in the Behavior implementation Class and the Edit button got activated finally but I am a lost here as I am thinking that I am missing a step that I don't know about, the only thing that came to my mind that as per this tutorial : Providing Authorization Control for a Business Configuration Maintenance Object | SAP Tutorials

I have to assign IAM App to business Catalog but the option of assigning it, it doesn't show in my ADT

 
 

the above option is not available in my ADT in the below screenshot

so @patrick_winkler , Could you please provide me with any Info or what is the problem exactly or some sort of guidance to put my thoughts in order?

entry.title: Re: How to create a RAP BO to change the content of a customizing table in the production client
entry.content:
@patrick_winkler 
here is the code snippets, if you want to take a look

CLASS LHC_ZI_CUSTOMTABLE_VH_S DEFINITION FINAL INHERITING FROM CL_ABAP_BEHAVIOR_HANDLER.
  PUBLIC SECTION.
    CONSTANTS:
      CO_ENTITY TYPE abp_entity_name VALUE `ZI_CUSTOMTABLE_VH_S`,
      CO_TRANSPORT_OBJECT TYPE mbc_cp_api=>indiv_transaction_obj_name VALUE `ZCUSTOMTABLE_VH`,
      CO_AUTHORIZATION_ENTITY TYPE abp_entity_name VALUE `ZI_CUSTOMTABLEVALUEHEL`.

  PRIVATE SECTION.
    METHODS:
      GET_INSTANCE_FEATURES FOR INSTANCE FEATURES
        IMPORTING
          KEYS REQUEST requested_features FOR CustomTableValueAll
        RESULT result,
      GET_GLOBAL_AUTHORIZATIONS FOR GLOBAL AUTHORIZATION
        IMPORTING
           REQUEST requested_authorizations FOR CustomTableValueAll
        RESULT result,
      EDIT FOR MODIFY
        IMPORTING
          KEYS FOR ACTION CustomTableValueAll~edit.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS LHC_ZI_CUSTOMTABLE_VH_S IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD GET_INSTANCE_FEATURES.
  mbc_cp_api=>rap_bc_api( )->get_instance_features(
    transport_object   = co_transport_object
    entity             = co_entity
    keys               = REF #( keys )
    requested_features = REF #( requested_features )
    result             = REF #( result )
    failed             = REF #( failed )
    reported           = REF #( reported ) ).
  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD GET_GLOBAL_AUTHORIZATIONS.
  mbc_cp_api=>rap_bc_api( )->get_global_authorizations(
    entity                   = co_authorization_entity
    requested_authorizations = REF #( requested_authorizations )
    result                   = REF #( result )
    reported                 = REF #( reported ) ).
  ENDMETHOD.
  METHOD EDIT.
*  mbc_cp_api=>rap_bc_api( )->get_default_transport_request(
*    transport_object = co_transport_object
*    entity           = co_entity
*    keys             = REF #( keys )
*    mapped           = REF #( mapped )
*    failed           = REF #( failed )
*    reported         = REF #( reported ) ).
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.
CLASS LSC_ZI_CUSTOMTABLE_VH_S DEFINITION FINAL INHERITING FROM CL_ABAP_BEHAVIOR_SAVER.
  PROTECTED SECTION.
    METHODS:
      SAVE_MODIFIED REDEFINITION.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS LSC_ZI_CUSTOMTABLE_VH_S IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD SAVE_MODIFIED.
*  mbc_cp_api=>rap_bc_api( )->record_changes(
*    transport_object = lhc_ZI_CustomTable_VH_S=>co_transport_object
*    entity           = lhc_ZI_CustomTable_VH_S=>co_entity
*    create           = REF #( create )
*    update           = REF #( update )
*    delete           = REF #( delete )
*    reported         = REF #( reported ) ).
*  mbc_cp_api=>rap_bc_api( )->update_last_changed_date_time(
*    maintenance_object = 'ZCUSTOMTABLE_VH'
*    entity             = lhc_ZI_CustomTable_VH_S=>co_authorization_entity
*    create             = REF #( create )
*    update             = REF #( update )
*    delete             = REF #( delete )
*    reported           = REF #( reported ) ).
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.
CLASS LHC_ZI_CUSTOMTABLEVALUEHEL DEFINITION FINAL INHERITING FROM CL_ABAP_BEHAVIOR_HANDLER.
  PUBLIC SECTION.
    CONSTANTS:
      CO_ENTITY TYPE sxco_cds_object_name VALUE `ZI_CUSTOMTABLEVALUEHEL`.

  PRIVATE SECTION.
    METHODS:
      GET_GLOBAL_FEATURES FOR GLOBAL FEATURES
        IMPORTING
          REQUEST REQUESTED_FEATURES FOR CustomTableValueHel
        RESULT result,
      DEPRECATE FOR MODIFY
        IMPORTING
          KEYS FOR ACTION CustomTableValueHel~Deprecate
        RESULT result,
      INVALIDATE FOR MODIFY
        IMPORTING
          KEYS FOR ACTION CustomTableValueHel~Invalidate
        RESULT result,
      COPY FOR MODIFY
        IMPORTING
          KEYS FOR ACTION CustomTableValueHel~Copy,
      GET_GLOBAL_AUTHORIZATIONS FOR GLOBAL AUTHORIZATION
        IMPORTING
           REQUEST requested_authorizations FOR CustomTableValueHel
        RESULT result,
      GET_INSTANCE_FEATURES FOR INSTANCE FEATURES
        IMPORTING
          KEYS REQUEST requested_features FOR CustomTableValueHel
        RESULT result.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS LHC_ZI_CUSTOMTABLEVALUEHEL IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD GET_GLOBAL_FEATURES.
  mbc_cp_api=>rap_bc_api( )->get_global_features(
    transport_object   = lhc_ZI_CustomTable_VH_S=>co_transport_object
    entity             = co_entity
    requested_features = REF #( requested_features )
    result             = REF #( result )
    reported           = REF #( reported ) ).
  ENDMETHOD.
  METHOD DEPRECATE.
  mbc_cp_api=>rap_bc_api( )->deprecate_entity(
    entity   = co_entity
    keys     = REF #( keys )
    result   = REF #( result )
    mapped   = REF #( mapped )
    failed   = REF #( failed )
    reported = REF #( reported ) ).
  ENDMETHOD.
  METHOD INVALIDATE.
  mbc_cp_api=>rap_bc_api( )->invalidate_entity(
    entity   = co_entity
    keys     = REF #( keys )
    result   = REF #( result )
    mapped   = REF #( mapped )
    failed   = REF #( failed )
    reported = REF #( reported ) ).
  ENDMETHOD.
  METHOD COPY.
  mbc_cp_api=>rap_bc_api( )->copy_by_association(
    entity   = co_entity
    keys     = REF #( keys )
    mapped   = REF #( mapped )
    failed   = REF #( failed )
    reported = REF #( reported ) ).
  ENDMETHOD.
  METHOD GET_GLOBAL_AUTHORIZATIONS.
  mbc_cp_api=>rap_bc_api( )->get_global_authorizations(
    entity                   = lhc_ZI_CustomTable_VH_S=>co_authorization_entity
    requested_authorizations = REF #( requested_authorizations )
    result                   = REF #( result )
    reported                 = REF #( reported ) ).
  ENDMETHOD.
  METHOD GET_INSTANCE_FEATURES.
  mbc_cp_api=>rap_bc_api( )->get_action_features(
    entity             = co_entity
    keys               = REF #( keys )
    requested_features = REF #( requested_features )
    result             = REF #( result )
    failed             = REF #( failed )
    reported           = REF #( reported ) ).
  ENDMETHOD.

ENDCLASS.
managed  implementation in class ZBP_I_CUSTOMTABLE_VH_S unique;
strict;
with draft;
define behavior for ZI_CustomTable_VH_S alias CustomTableValueAll
draft table ZDBT_COUPA__D_S
with unmanaged save
lock master total etag LastChangedAtMax
authorization master( global )
{
  field ( readonly )
   SingletonID;

  field ( features : instance )
   TransportRequestID;

  field ( notrigger )
   SingletonID,
   LastChangedAtMax;


  update;
  internal create;
  internal delete;

  draft action ( features : instance ) Edit with additional implementation;
  draft action Activate optimized;
  draft action Discard;
  draft action Resume;
  draft determine action Prepare;

  association _CustomTableValueHel { create ( features : instance ); with draft; }



}

define behavior for ZI_CustomTableValueHel alias CustomTableValueHel ##UNMAPPED_FIELD
persistent table ZDBT_COUPA_HELP2
draft table ZDBT_COUPA_HE_D
lock dependent by _CustomTableValueAll
authorization dependent by _CustomTableValueAll
{
  field ( mandatory : create )
   AppId,
   AppSequence,
   FieldName;

  field ( readonly )
   SingletonID,
   CreatedBy,
   LastChangedBy,
   ConfigDeprecationCode,
   ConfigDeprecationCode_Critlty;

  field ( readonly : update )
   AppId,
   AppSequence,
   FieldName;

  field ( notrigger )
   SingletonID,
   CreatedBy,
   LastChangedBy;


  update( features : global );
  delete( features : instance );

  action ( features : instance ) Deprecate result [1] $self;
  action ( features : instance ) Invalidate result [1] $self;
  factory action ( features : instance ) Copy parameter ZD_CopyCustomTable_VH [1];

  mapping for ZDBT_COUPA_HELP2
  {
    AppId = APP_ID;
    AppSequence = APP_SEQUENCE;
    FieldName = FIELD_NAME;
    FieldValue = FIELD_VALUE;
    CreatedBy = CREATED_BY;
    CreatedOn = CREATED_ON;
    CreatedAt = CREATED_AT;
    LastChangedBy = LAST_CHANGED_BY;
    LastChangedOn = LAST_CHANGED_ON;
    LastChangedAt = LAST_CHANGED_AT;
    ConfigDeprecationCode = CONFIGDEPRECATIONCODE;
  }

  association _CustomTableValueAll { with draft; }


}
{
  "formatVersion": "1",
  "header": {
    "description": "Maintain Custom Table value Help Coupa",
    "originalLanguage": "en",
    "abapLanguageVersion": "cloudDevelopment"
  },
  "clientDependent": true,
  "languageDependent": "noLanguageKey",
  "category": "customizing",
  "transportRecording": "notSupported",
  "adaptableInProduction": true,
  "tableItems": [
    {
      "tableName": "ZDBT_COUPA_HELP2",
      "isPrimaryTable": true
    }
  ]
}

1. Created ZDAYPRODCUST  Planning Level, on top of  it created a Key Figure ZDAYPRODCUST.

2. Created new Planning Level ZDAYPRODCUSTNEW by copying ZDAYPRODCUST.

3. Created a new Key Figure ZDAYPRODCUST365DAY using ZDAYPRODCUST as the Base Planning Level and used ZDAYPRODCUSTNEW as the input for @request Level.

4. While creating the Attribute Transformation Key Figure, I noticed that only the following PeriodIDs were available. As a workaround, I proceeded to offset the values at the Day level and created the necessary Planning Levels and Key Figures accordingly, as outlined above.

 

Any help is appreciated.
Thanks a lot in advance for your support!

Best Regards,
Kiran

entry.title: Re: Material Requirements simulation app in S4 HANA. Publ...
entry.content:
Hi Nihit,

While Predictive MRP (pMRP) is not a perfect match to the classic LTP capabilities, it does offer simulation capabilities and scenario planning. I would suggest to review the following learning hub link for more details - pMRP

Madhavan

entry.title: Story Report with Direct Reports AND Salary with Acting Pay
entry.content:
Hello,

I am trying to create a story report with a cross-tab table that shows both:

1. The number of direct reports each employee has. Only direct reports that have employee class = employee should be included.

2. A calculated value that shows the employee's annualized salary, as well as their annualized acting pay. These come from 2 different pay components which are then multiplied by the standard hours worked to get an annualized value. 

 

  • The direct reports field on the user entity cannot be used since there is no way to apply any filtering based on employee class. The direct report measure is a dimension count of the user ids in the direct report entity.
  • The annualized salary and annualized acting pay are calculated columns based on the 'Amount' field in recurring pay, restricted by pay component using an if statement. The aggregation for both columns is set to max. 
  • Both of the above measures work fine. The issue comes when calculating the annualized salary with acting pay: the annualized salary with acting pay is a calculated column that must have the aggregation value set to 'sum' rather than 'max' to show up properly in the table, as it is adding values that exist on different rows. 

Here is what the record set looks like prior to summarizing in a cross-tab: 

 

EmployeeDirect ReportEmployee Annual SalaryEmployee Annual Acting Pay
100-50000-
100--5000
10110250000-
101102--
10110350000-
101103--
10110450000-
101104--
10510650000-
105106-5000
10510750000-
105107-5000
10510850000-
105108-5000
  • Employee 100 has 0 direct reports and $5000 annual acting pay
  • Employee 101 has 3 direct reports and no acting pay
  • Employee 105 has 3 direct reports and $5000 annual acting pay

Here is what I want to show in the cross-tab: 

EmployeeDirect ReportsEmployee SalaryEmployee Acting PayEmployee Salary with Acting Pay
100-50000500055000
101350000050000
1053500005000

55000

Here is what actually shows in the cross-tab:

EmployeeDirect ReportsEmployee SalaryEmployee Acting PayEmployee Salary with Acting Pay
100-50000500055000
101350000050000
1053500005000165000

The salary with acting pay reports correctly for employee 100 and 101. The salary with acting pay shows up multiplied by the number of direct reports for the employee that has both direct reports and acting pay.

Does anyone have any ideas on how to resolve?

entry.title: SAP CodeJam Roadshow LATAM - 2025, the First Half Recap, Being Present is About More Than Words.
entry.content:
Being present, is about more than words

So a few months ago back in April  I was chatting with my developer advocate colleague @ajmaradiaga about my new role as a Community Advocate and doing more outreach.  Attending more events in person specifically, and one type of event that we need to be present at is the SAP Inside Track (SIT's) and I was invited by the amazing team in Brazil that runs so many SIT events in Brazil. In particular I was asked to attend, and then asked to speak, and then speak twice, at the SIT in São Paulo.  The goal of this outreach was to have our team of Community Advocates be more present and listen and talk in person more, and not just online.  In talking about this plan with Developer Advocate Antonio Maradiaga he had a thought.   After the success of last years LATAM roadshow (that he and I did)  he said since he was going to do it again this year with a goal to visit a few cities they hadn't been to, Lima Peru and Mexico city, and also a repeat visit in Bogota.  But since I was going to be in São Paulo on a Saturday for the SIT and the encontro the day before (Antonio helped organize a local meetup called an encontro and @RobertaFernande picked a great spot) maybe I could host a #CodeJam there and then meet him and @RichHeilman the next week in Lima.  Of course I agreed and the plan was set to use the SAP office and have a GenAI CodeJam in São Paulo.

Being present, again and unintended effects:

Fast forward to SAP Sapphire in Orlando. I’m giving a presentation on community and also attending meetings with the SAP Mentors. In one meeting I’m next to @ChrisRae  and he says “mate, gotta head to an #Apphaus meeting, can you join?"

I say sure and follow him over.  Then when I walk in, I’m amazed to see a lot of faces in person that I’d been emailing with about growing the SAP Community presence at the Apphaus locations.  I say a few words and talk about how the team of Developer Advocates can host a CodeJam or I can have meetings at their space if they are willing to host.  All of the partners love this idea. Then a person came up at the end of the meeting named Renan Guedes. He said he runs the Apphaus in São Paulo and wanted me to visit when I was there. I said hey, why don’t I ask Antonio to move the CodeJam from our office to the Apphaus.

Apphaus meetinFirst time meeting Renan

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Pretty cool!  First half of the LATAM roadshow is set. 

  • CodeJam at the exec consulting Apphaus
  • Meetup at bar 
  • SIT São Paulo at the campus of PUC 
  • Then off to Lima for the next CodeJam and a quedada (meetup in español)
  • Bonus, I got a coffee with SAP Mentor @Raquel_PereiradaCunha me and Raquel

Being present, the reality

I land in Brazil. My colleague @SavioMarques10  agrees to pick me up and we can go to get a coffee then attend get to the CodeJam and setup early. Savio showing me the best coffee!

It’s a great space and the team at Exed Consulting are so gracious. They welcome our local attendees and we are off showcasing how to sue GenAI in BTP. I have great conversations in English as my Portuguese is, lacking. We even did a podcast!

Apphaus group photo

CodeJam in action

Then after we have gone through our 5-6 hours of content we break for day. I’m hopeful to see a few of the attendees at the meetup along with some of the SIT attendees who are already in town.  I’m blown away. We get about 25 people. Several form the CodeJams and several sit.  A few SAP Champions are there like @Marssel700 and I even get a present for the next day, a couple of shirts, SIT shirts. One even has my name.

SIT Shirts

 

encontro São Paulo

I’m not too tired but want to make sure I’m able to get some rest and prepare for my two sessions and also have great conversations so I head back to the hotel, which for some reason has blue stains on the pillow case?

I called this section “being present, the reality” but I had no idea just how many great conversations I would have. How many photos I would take with the attendees. Roberta  even made a Brazilian flat Josh!!!

Brazilian flat Josh, also taller than me

 

I give my presentation on the technical side of the conference. I have a great lunch with a few locals and then my colleague Savio makes sure I meetup with a new colleague I met at the CodeJams named Arthur who agrees to make sure if I need anything he’s there to help.  Everyone is so kind.  For those interested in a photo but don't want a 1-1 we meet at the court for a group photo!

 

My second presentation is great and the audience is very happy when I end with a slide stating “Vai Conrinthians!” and the logo of the local favorite football team (soccer to me…), that was my loudest applause and cheers of the day!

Group selfie at SIT São Paulo

 

We have a wrap up meal with several of the SIT organizers and then the next I'm off to Lima Peru where there are two code jams and a meetup Called a quedada locally.  Me and the crew meet in the hotel lobby to strategize!

 

gotta be on the blue crue!

 The first of two CodeJam's is on ABAP so Rich takes the lead showing how to use Joule with ABAP code and prompting the system to give contextual responses based on the functions you put into your ABAP code.  The group in Lima is loving it and the exercises fly by as they consume code they know but in a new way.  ABAP CodeJam Lima

 

quedada Lima

I won’t be able to stay for the second CodeJam due to my travel schedule, but that’s ok cause I am sure the Lima attendees are in good hands with Antonio and Rich.  I even heard that most of the GenAI content on day 2 was translated on the fly to español by Antonio. 

My favorite memory of the CodeJam and quedada was what I usually say about every event, the people.  Conversations about music, food, life.  The amount of time some attendees took to travel to be with us is staggering and so overwhelming.  Being present really does something for me that I am not sure the attendees of our community event’s realize. It’s not about what we discuss, what they learn, what product issue we may solve.  It’s the connection, the memories made together that are chapters in this amazing virtual novel I'm writing, event by event, called “My SAP Community journey”.  I hope you can all be present with us in some way and write your own stories.  Obrigado, gracias and thank you!

Oh, I almost forgot, Antonio made some world tour shirts!

Roadshow tour shirts by Antonio

 roadshow shirt close up

 

Now, for the second half of the LATAM roadshow I will hand over to my colleague @ajmaradiaga to let us know how things go in Mexico City and Bogota!

p.s. I am so sorry to all I can't post all the selfie pics and your name here, but maybe you can post the one's you took as a reply???

entry.title: Re: End-to-End Performance Testing of SAP BTP Cloud Foundry, Kyma and ABAP Environment based Applica
entry.content:
Hi Cocquerel,

Thanks for raising your query 🙂

Yes, Dynatrace can be bound with SAP CAP applications as well.

Please refer to this FAQ: https://pages.github.tools.sap/apm/faq

Query:

Can I enhance monitoring for my SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) Application?

Answer

Yes, SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) provides additional monitoring capabilities with Dynatrace. For example, you can track SAP HANA database calls of your Node.js applications. Perform performance troubleshooting and CPU/Memory time spend on CAP-Java and much more.

The use of Dynatrace is as well part of the Golden Path together with the rest of the BTP Observability services.

You find instructions on how to enable this feature as well on our documentation and on capire.

Remark:

  1. In short let say if you have mta.yaml configuration file than create a Dynatrace instance in BTP(Using Json file, directly through BTP User Interface) , define this newly created dynatrace instance inside mta.yaml file :

Ex:

  •               resources:

- name: XXX-dynatrace-dev

  type: org.cloudfoundry.existing-service

  •               Add the service in requires section of the Modules to be monitored.

requires:

  - name:

XXX-dynatrace-monitor

  1. Bind the Dynatrace service to BTP CF deployed application- cf bind-service
    (check if this is needed in your case since we are explicitly maintaining the newly created dynatrace instance name in mta.yaml file , most probably redeployment should work - cf deploy or via mbt build)

Remark: In case you are not able to see your binded CAP application service  in Dynatrace (even after redeploy/restart)

  • Sometimes a restart of the application is not enough, it needs to be a restage (only during staging the agent will be downloaded). Please restage your application and see if the process shows up after max 3 minutes(cf restage YOUR-APP)
  • Also try renaming your  Dynatrace service to something containing “dynatrace”, e.g.

Ex: Dynatrace instance creation using JSON file

cf create-service dynatrace environment test-dynatrace -c <json> file

and then bind the app/redeploy and restage again.

Reference : https://docs.cloudfoundry.org/devguide/deploy-apps/start-restart-restage.html

entry.title: Re: Error: Failed to create ad-hoc schema export using ba...
entry.content:
Hi Team,

There is a file located at /var/log/SAPBusinessOne/Backupservice/logs/SID_SERVER_PORT: SCHEMA_NAME.pid. This file is editable. Open it and delete all the numbers, keeping only the largest one. After that, the export should run successfully.

I am using SAP 10 2411 Patch. I tried the same solution, but it didn’t work for me. So, I deleted the SCHEMA_NAME.pid file. After that, the export ran successfully.

entry.title: Post Asset Retirement as of OP2025 Private Cloud Edition with Universal Parallel Accounting (UPA)
entry.content:
Purpose

As of OP2025 Private Cloud Edition with UPA, the new Fiori app 'Post Asset Retirement'  has replaced two old, GUI-based apps:

  • Post Retirement (Non-Integrated) - Without Customer
  • Post Retirement - By Scrapping

This article describes the main features of the app, deep-diving into the details by comparing it with its predecessors. It also describes the customization of currency types in General Ledger Accounting (G/L), as well as analysis on some errors caused by impropper setups there.

Business Transaction Type

Similar to what you do in the Fiori app Post Asset Acquisition, you must enter company code, asset numbers, and a couple of mandatory fields for dates, i.e. Journal Entry Date, Posting Date, and Asset Value Date.

What's more important:  In the section 'Transaction Details', you must choose one 'Business Transaction Type' from the list, to tell the system: Do you want to retire the asset with or without any revenue?

⚠️Business Transaction Type has been introduced since the first Fiori app for asset posting was published, i.e. Post Asset Acquisition. As the successor, Business Transaction Type is much simpler than its predecessor, the traditional 3-digit-code of transaction type, which is not required as an input in any Fiori app for asset posting now.

Posting Parameters

The section 'Posting Data' is the place for you to enter the posting parameters. In the sub-section 'Valuation'', you can choose the ledgers and depreciation areas you that want to post to. ➡️ Once you choose a ledger, the system derives the depreciation areas from the ledger, and vice versa.

⚠️Hint: If you don't choose anything, neither ledger nor depreciation area, you'll post to all ledgers and all depreciation areas that are included in the current asset.

The 'Retirement Type' in the sub-section 'Retirement Details' is one of the most important fields of the app. The system gives you three options as following.

Partial Retirement

All these options are straightforward. However, if you compare retirement types above with those in its predecessor apps, you will find a bigg difference: you have only two options for your partial retirement, by amount or by percentage. 

In other words, the percentage of the partial retirement can only be decided by the amount or the percentage rate manually entered. ➡️ Even if the asset manages quantity, you cannot enter a quantity and ask the system to decide the percentage of the partial retirement from this quantity.

For example, in the current fiscal year, your assset has been capitalized with the amount 12,000 EUR and the quantity 10PC. With the posting parameters below, you will retire it by 50%, but only deduct the quantity by 3PC.

Obviously, in this example above, you only have acquisition postings in the current year. So you must choose 'Current Year'  in the field 'Year of Acquisition'. If you have prior-year acquisitions and you want to retire that part, you must choose 'Prior Year'.

⚠️ Only when you are going for a partial retirement, can you see these fields in the page: Retirement Amount, Quantity, & Year of Acquisition.

Retirement with Revenue

Once you choose the business transaction type 'Retirement with Revenue', some more fields will appear in the section 'Posting Data'.  

Like what you did in the predecessor apps, you can supply the revenue amount with the net book value (NBV) of a given depreciation area. By doing that, you will not generate any P&L effect.

Alternatively, you can manually enter the revenue amount yourself. 

 

⚠️ In this Fiori app, you cannot enter a revenue in any currency. Instead, you can only pick a currency type from the list via Currency Type of Revenue. This is different from the past. 

➡️ To avoid complex UI interaction, Currency Type of Revenue contains a full list of currency types supported by the company code. For example, the company code may support 3 currency types below, and all of them will appear in the list. ➡️  Check out the next chapter for more details about currency types.

  • 10 - Company Code Currency
  • 30 - Group Currency
  • 40 - Hard Currency

If the ledger 4G does not manage 40 (Hard Currency) but you only post your retirement to 4G, on hitting the button 'Display Line Items' or 'Simulate', you will get an error like below.

Customization of Currency Types

Currency Type is a complex setup in General Ledger Accounting (G/L). Asset Accounting is well integrated with G/L, especially with regard to currency types. So, it is worth giving some more words.

First, where can you find the currency types that are being managed by a ledger within a company code?

Run the t-code FINSC_LEDGER, choose a ledger from the node 'Ledger', navigate to the node 'Company Code Settings for the Ledger', and you will find this configuration.  ➡️ Here, in this example, the ledger BU in company code 1010 only supports two customerized currency types: ZU as the local currency type and ZV as the group currency type.

Next, how are those customized currency types related to the standard ones? 

Go to the node 'Currency Type', and check out the individual currency types. ➡️ Here, in this example, you can see that ZU and ZV are actually almost the same things as the standard currency types 10 and 30, but only with a different valuation view type: 3 (Segmentation Valuation). ➡️ In other words, ZU and ZV are just copies of currency types 10 and 30, but they are only designed for Segment Valuation.

Last but not least, which currency types are listed for the revenue amount in the Fiori app F7107?

In this example, the company code 1010 has many ledgers assigned, and with a lot of currency types, as shown in the database table FINSC_LD_CMP (below).

However, only 10, 30, 40 and Z0 are basic ones, a.k.a. 'Legal Currency Type' / 'Plain Currency Type', as shown in the database table FINSC_CURTYPE (below). All other currency types are just different valuations of those legal/plain currency types.

Therefore, the Fiori app only lists those legal/plain currency types for the revenue amount.

Errors about Currency Types

On hitting the button 'Simulate' or 'Post', you will get errors around currency types. Whenever you have this kind of error, most likely you have selected a wrong currency type of the revenue amount. 

One typical example is the error below. You can easily find the reason behind if you have another look at the table FINSC_LD_CMP (screenshot above): company code 1010 and ledger 4G has only defined currency types 11 and 31, whose plain/legal currency types are 10 and 30. And Z0 is not one of them.

Another example, in the screenshot below, the error KM132 states the currency type Z0 and valuation type 2 do not fit together. Then, please go back to check the table FINSC_CURTYPE (see the corresponding screenshot above) once again. ➡️ It is easy to see that no currency type has been defined as a copy of plain/legal currency type Z0 for valuation type 2 ('Profit Center Valuation'). 

Now, you want to retire the asset on BU and OD only. But you still get the error KM132. This time, it states the currency type Z0 and valuation type 3 do not fit together. 

Well, please go back to the database table FINSC_CURTYPE once more. This time the error is about valuation type 3, Segmentation Valuation. Then, the system looks up the table for the entries with 'VALUESUBTYP' (Subtype of Valuation View) BU for the plain/legal currency type Z0. There is no hit at all.

⚠️Corresponding configuration of VALUESUBTYP is inside the currency type settings below. And it is used ONLY for Segmentation Valuation.

Summary

You may have noticed it already that some posting parameters in this Fiori app used to be part of classic, 3-digit-code transaction types. But now, you can directly enter/choose them in the Fiori UI, without being confused by the 3-digit-codes.

Asset Accounting (AA) is well integrated with General Ledger (G/L). Some errors, especially those about ledgers or currency types, are reported from G/L but not AA. It is always helpful to check out the configrations in the t-code FINSC_LEDGER.

In OP2025 Private Cloud Edition with UPA, some other new Fiori apps are delivered as well. You may refer to the following SAP note to check out all those new apps as well as their tiles and busniess catalogs.

3614510 - Business Catalogs and Tiles for Asset Accounting with/without Universal Parallel Accounting in S/4HANA Private Cloud 2025 - SAP for Me

entry.title: Investment Boost: A significant step to promote economic growth
entry.content:
Co-Authors: @frank_afeaki and @olga_lazareva 

The New Zealand government has taken a significant step towards promoting economic growth with the launch of the "Investment Boost" initiative in Budget 2025.  This major tax incentive allows businesses to instantly deduct 20% of the cost of new assets, in addition to their regular depreciation. This substantial change is set to reduce tax liabilities and enhance cash flow, thereby empowering businesses to invest and grow.

While this news is undoubtedly welcome, it also presents the technical challenge of integrating this incentive into existing SAP Finance systems. Businesses must now adapt their asset accounting process to ensure they can fully leverage the benefits of the "Investment Boost" while maintaining compliance and operational efficiency. 

To take advantage of this tax benefit, our customers are required to post the 20% instant depreciation in addition to the regular depreciation. The key challenge here is to achieve the 20% immediate depreciation from the capitalization date while continuing regular depreciation.

For this special scenario, we chose to use the depreciation type 'special depreciation'. This type of depreciation allows for percentage depreciation and is commonly used for tax purposes. Using this depreciation type, in phase 1 we can apply a 20% special depreciation, which depreciates the asset by 20%. After this, phase 1 will continue with regular depreciation and depreciate based on the asset's useful life. However, the regular depreciation will now start with a net book value that is 20% less than the actual cost.

  • Phase 1: Special depreciation to post 20% of Investment Boost on the date of capitalization
  • Phase 1: Continue phase 1 with the regular depreciation, based on useful life, where reference value is Acquisition and Production Costs (APC) minus 20% special depreciation

To configure the keys, we need 2 different multi-level methods. The first multi-level method (IBS) is designed to cater to the 20% special depreciation, while the second method (IBR) is designed for regular depreciation.

Multilevel method for Special depreciation - IBS

Multilevel method for Special depreciation - IBR

Let's proceed to the configuration of the necessary depreciation keys. 

Sample Key for declining method:

Sample Key for straight line method:

We have tested the scenarios detailed below using the new investment boost depreciation keys, but we recommend that you perform your own testing to confirm that your results are as expected.

1. Investment boost posting with special depreciation key

The test was successful, with the 20% investment boost posted under special depreciation and the asset continued to depreciate based on useful life, with a reference value of APC minus 20% special depreciation. Example screenshot of the 20% investment boost posted with acquisition:

2. Subsequent additional acquisitions

The test was successful, result of test was the expected result. Example screenshot of additional acquisition:

3. Partial intra-company transfers and partial retirement

Unfortunately, this test was not successful, and the investment boost was doubled. Example screenshot of the partial intra-company transfer:

To overcome the issues with the partial transfers and partial retirement, we had to design a new depreciation key, in this example NIMD which allowed for no additional special depreciation posting during transfers and retirement. To achieve this, we propose a workaround based on time intervals which would fix these inconsistencies. 

Key points to remember here are:

  • The depreciation key NIMD is designed with a special depreciation phase with base method 23 which allows for no additional special depreciation during partial transfers and retirement.
  • Needs to be assigned to both the sender and the receiver asset.
  • Works from the beginning of the period and does not provide scope for changes in between the period.

Sample depreciation key for partial transfers and retirement:

Screenshot of changing the asset depreciation key to the NIMD depreciation key using time intervals on the asset as well as the successful partial intra-company transfers.

Sending asset - intra-company transfer:

Receiver Asset - intra-company transfer: 

4.  Subsequent qualifying investment boost acquisition against existing assets:

This scenario is relevant for assets that were acquired before the investment boost period.  Here, you cannot change to the investment boost depreciation key using time interval as you will more likely get the error message "AA591: Depreciation key has more depreciation types than the previous deprec. key".

See the screenshot below using the Investment boost straight line depreciation key NIBS

As a workaround, we propose you create an asset sub-number of the original asset using the investment boost depreciation key and book the acquisition against the new asset sub number.

Conclusion

In summary, the implementation of the new investment boost scheme offers a powerful opportunity for businesses to benefit from significant tax incentives and enhanced cash flow. However, maximizing these advantages will require the configuration of new multi-level depreciation keys to incorporate the investment boost requirements.  Creating and using the new multi-level investment boost depreciation keys will meet the main requirements, but a work around is required to handle scenarios such as a partial intra-company and partial retirements, as described above. By configuring the workaround described above, which involves a time interval adjustment on the asset, organizations can ensure accurate compliance and optimize their use of the investment boost. Diligent testing and thoughtful setup are essential for successfully navigating these complexities and securing the full benefit of this government initiative.

entry.title: The estimate cost field USER4 in AUFK or CAUFV table not updating
entry.content:
Dear experts,

I am facing an issue with Estimated Cost not getting updated in AUFK or CAUFV table. I am describing the issue below:

We have an enhancement where we are copying the planned cost to the order header estimated cost (USER4) field during the order Release if the estimated cost is blank. The value is getting populated correctly under the order header frontend but if I am checking the table AUFK or CAUFV the USER4 field value is blank and impacting the order report.

How to update the USER4 field value in AUFK or CAUFV table or are there any FM or other tables which stores this value. My first assumption is that SAP locks any update on the estimate cost field USER4 post Release status. Any suggestions are most welcome.

Thanks,

Rahul
